alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Rock Island; Whiteside (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 2:39PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Whiteside, south central Carroll, northeastern Rock Island, northeastern Scott, eastern Clinton and southeastern Jackson Counties through 330 PM CDT... At 238 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Clinton, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Clinton around 255 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Fulton, Low Moor, Camanche, East Clinton and Albany. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
